intro: Aquilegia vulgaris subsp. pubiflora, commonly known as the pubiflora columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers, which are typically blue or purple in color. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and a basal rosette of foliage. It thrives in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized landscapes.
